N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 421.12 - Application

State Regulations
(a) Authorized agencies operating an adoption
program shall use an application form approved by the department to elicit the
following information from adoptive applicants: (1)
name, address and other necessary
identifying information; (2)
age, race and religion of members of the household; (3)
whether applicant is a certified or
licensed foster parent; and
(4)
characteristics of child(ren) sought to be adopted. (b) Authorized agencies shall develop a
record for each adoptive applicant which shall include, but not necessarily be
limited to: (1)
record of inquiry maintained
in accordance with section
421.11
(i) of this

Part; (2)
the application, medical
report and references; (3)
summary
of interviews with applicant and of visit to applicant's home; (4)
summary of agency conference which
clarifies the basis for each decision that affects the applicant's status with
the agency; and
(5)
copies of all
correspondence with the applicant. (c) Authorized agencies shall register each
adoptive applicant who expresses a willingness to adopt a handicapped or
hard-to-place child with the adoptive parent registry as required in section
424.2
of this Title. Notes
